Module 2: Compliance-First Operations

Module 2: Compliance-First Operations

1.0 Strategic Mandate

This is the most critical module in the Insurance OS. In the 2024-2025 landscape, compliance is not a back-office administrative task; it is the central, non-negotiable strategic foundation of the entire agency.

The "buy-and-dial" era is over. The modern agency operates in a zero-tolerance regulatory environment. Failure to build on a "Compliance-First" chassis will result in agency-ending fines, license revocation, and carrier termination.

The goal of this module is to build a defensible, audit-ready agency where compliance is an automated, integrated, and non-negotiable part of the daily workflow.

2.0 Core Compliance Pillars

This system is built to manage the five key areas of regulatory risk.

  • TCPA (Calling & Texting): Governs all outbound contact. The new "One-to-One Consent" rule is the single greatest threat to traditional lead generation models.
  • CMS (Medicare & ACA): The "10-Year Mandates" for recording all sales calls and storing all consent documentation are non-negotiable for any agent in the health market.
  • NAIC (Suitability & Best Interest): Governs product recommendations, especially for IUL and annuities. Requires a documented, defensible process to prove the recommendation is in the client's best interest.
  • HIPAA & Data Privacy): Governs the storage and handling of Protected Health Information (PHI) and Personal Identifiable Information (PII). A data breach is an existential risk.
  • DOL (Fiduciary Rule): Governs advice related to 401(k) rollovers and qualified funds, primarily impacting annuity and investment-related sales.
